item.content:encoded: üå≥ Introducing scikit-tree üå≥ https://t.co/oAlajoRbg0 An extension of scikit-learn that adds new features and improvements for decision-tree models. üëá Thread üëá

item.title:
1/ What are decision trees?
Traditionally, decision trees are a non-parametric learning method used for classification and regression. They can also be used for unsupervised learning!
They are easy to understand, visualize and interpret. üôå
item.description:
1/ What are decision trees?

They are easy to understand, visualize and interpret. üôå
item.content:encoded: 1/ What are decision trees? Traditionally, decision trees are a non-parametric learning method used for classification and regression. They can also be used for unsupervised learning! They are easy to understand, visualize and interpret. üôå

item.title:
2/ What are the advantages of decision trees?
They can handle both numerical and categorical data. They can handle multi-output problems. They are fast, robust to noise and can handle high-dimensional problems with low-sample sizes.
item.description:
2/ What are the advantages of decision trees?

item.content:encoded: 2/ What are the advantages of decision trees? They can handle both numerical and categorical data. They can handle multi-output problems. They are fast, robust to noise and can handle high-dimensional problems with low-sample sizes.

item.title:
3/ How does scikit-tree improve decision trees?
scikit-tree adds new features, such as:
New splitters: oblique splitting New trees: oblique trees, manifold oblique trees, unsupervised trees New tree functionalities (alpha functionality): estimating distances between samples
item.description:

item.title:
4/ How to install and use scikit-tree?
scikit-tree is available on PyPI. You can install it with:
pip install scikit-tree
Then you can import it as:
from sktree import ObliqueRandomForestClassifier
You can use it as you would use scikit-learn, with the same API.

item.title:
6/ Why scikit-tree?
scikit-tree aims to advance the state-of-the-art of decision tree algorithms in Python, while staying in-line with changes from upstream scikit-learn.
It is a community-driven project that welcomes contributions from anyone interested in decision trees.
